content: The world is a book, and those who do not travel read only a page.
author: Augustine of Hippo

content: All is flux; nothing stays still.
author: Heraclitus

content: If you don't know where you are going, you will probably end up somewhere else.
author: Laurence J. Peter
The Buddha
content: A disciplined mind brings happiness.
We never understand how little we need in this world until we know the loss of it.
author: J. M. Barrie
Abraham Lincoln
content: The ballot is stronger than the bullet.
Change in all things is sweet.
author: Aristotle

content: There is no failure except in no longer trying.
author: Elbert Hubbard

content: When people are like each other they tend to like each other.
author: Tony Robbins

content: It has become appallingly obvious that our technology has exceeded our humanity.
author: Albert Einstein
Abraham Lincoln
content: I will prepare and someday my chance will come.
Cleverness is not wisdom.
author: Euripides

content: While we stop to think, we often miss our opportunity.
author: Publilius Syrus

content: It is only when the mind and character slumber that the dress can be seen.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: Be miserable. Or motivate yourself. Whatever has to be done, it's always your choice.
author: Wayne Dyer

content: Be courteous to all, but intimate with few, and let those few be well tried before you give them your confidence.
author: George Washington

content: Friendship is but another name for an alliance with the follies and the misfortunes of others. Our own share of miseries is sufficient: why enter then as volunteers into those of another?
author: Thomas Jefferson
Winston Churchill
content: The inherent vice of capitalism is the unequal sharing of blessings; the inherent virtue of socialism is the equal sharing of miseries.
I'm a great believer in luck and I find the harder I work, the more I have of it.
author: Thomas Jefferson

content: Never interrupt your enemy when he is making a mistake.
author: Napoleon
The Buddha
content: Some do not understand that we must die, But those who do realize this settle their quarrels.
Life is a succession of moments. To live each one is to succeed.
author: Corita Kent

content: The essence of true friendship is to make allowance for another's little lapses.
author: Ovid
Helmut Schmidt
content: The biggest room in the world is room for improvement.
The way you see people is the way you treat them, and the way you treat them is what they become.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
